intro: Appendicula humilis, commonly known as the dwarf appendicula, is a small flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. Appendicula humilis is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Its unique morphology and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
